Paragraph 2:
Next, put your urban exploration skills to the test with a scavenger hunt through the lively Montmartre neighborhood. Seek out hidden gems like the quirky "I Love You" wall covered in graffiti and the striking Sacré-Cœur Basilica perched atop the city's highest hill. Refuel with a stop at a cozy café for hot chocolate and macarons, then unleash your inner daredevil at an indoor trampoline park or laser tag arena.

Paragraph 3:
Cap off your adventure with an adrenaline-pumping visit to Disneyland Paris. Brave heart-pounding rollercoasters, whimsical rides, and mesmerizing shows throughout the magical park. As the sun sets, gather for a final indulgence – tantalizing Parisian sweets like éclairs and crème brûlée from a renowned patisserie. Share your favorite moments and memories from your action-packed Parisian escapade before bidding farewell to the City of Light.
Suggest activities for a day trip to Paris that will keep teenagers engaged, without mentioning museums or historical sites.

output:
Start the day with a guided street art workshop in the vibrant Belleville neighborhood. Local artists run 2-hour, teen-focused sessions where participants learn basic spray-painting techniques on a legal, community-approved wall—no risk of getting in trouble, just creative freedom. Teens can design their own small murals, tag-style art, or collaborative pieces to leave on the wall as a fun souvenir of the trip. After the workshop, head to the nearby street food truck park, where they can grab loaded gourmet fries, spicy Korean fried chicken, or colorful bubble tea to fuel up. The mix of hands-on creativity and casual snacking sets a laid-back, energetic tone for the rest of the day.

***

Midday, shift to high-speed fun at an indoor go-karting track on the edge of Paris, like Karting de Paris. Most tracks offer teen-specific sessions with adjustable karts and full safety gear, so they can compete against each other in timed laps or team races. The thrill of zooming around the track, drafting opponents, and trying to set the fastest lap will keep even the most easily distracted teens engaged. After the races, cool down at a trendy ice cream parlor that lets them build their own sundaes—think unlimited toppings like candy chunks, homemade syrups, and even edible glitter. The competitive rush followed by a sweet treat will keep their energy levels high.

***

Spend the afternoon at a cutting-edge virtual reality arcade in the 10th arrondissement. These spots offer a range of multiplayer VR games that cater to different interests: zombie survival missions where teams work together to fend off hordes, space battle simulators for sci-fi fans, or virtual paintball matches that feel surprisingly intense. For those who prefer something less action-packed, there are creative VR experiences like designing their own virtual worlds or exploring fantasy landscapes. After the VR session, rent electric scooters to zip along the Canal Saint-Martin—stopping to grab cold lemonade from a floating bar or snap silly photos with the colorful houseboats lined along the water.

***

Wrap up the day with a dessert crawl through the trendy Oberkampf neighborhood. Hit up three or four must-try spots: a bubble waffle shop with unique fillings like matcha ice cream and red bean paste, a churro stand with rich dark chocolate and salted caramel dipping sauces, and a crème brûlée bar where they can torch their own sugar topping with a mini blowtorch. End the night at an outdoor open-air cinema (seasonal) showing popular teen comedies or action flicks, or a teen-friendly comedy club with English-language sets that lean into relatable, lighthearted humor. The mix of indulgent sweets and casual entertainment will leave them with a fun, memorable end to their Paris day trip.

input.content: Your response should contain at least two sections highlighted using markdown, i.e. *highlighted section*. Your entire response should be in English and in all lowercase letters.

Write a product description for a new product called the "AirPods Max".

Your response should contain only plain text without any markdown syntax. Your entire response should be in English and in all uppercase letters.

HERE IS A PRODUCT DESCRIPTION FOR THE "AIRPODS MAX" IN ALL UPPERCASE LETTERS:

APPLE'S AIRPODS MAX ARE THE ULTIMATE PERSONAL LISTENING EXPERIENCE. ELEVATING IMMERSIVE SOUND, THEY BRING COMPUTATIONAL AUDIO TO A GORGEOUS OVER-EAR DESIGN WITH A BREATHTAKING HIGH-FIDELITY AUDIO EXPERIENCE. THE CUSTOM APPLE-DESIGNED DRIVER DELIVERS EXCEPTIONAL SOUND WITH INCREDIBLY LOW DISTORTION ACROSS A ULTRAWIDE FREQUENCY RANGE THAT EXTENDS FAR BEYOND THE CAPABILITIES OF CONVENTIONAL HEADPHONE DRIVERS. ACTIVE NOISE CANCELLATION BLOCKS OUTSIDE NOISE, ALLOWING YOU TO FULLY IMMERSE IN WHAT YOU'RE LISTENING TO. TRANSPARENCY MODE LETS OUTSIDE SOUND IN SO YOU CAN INTERACT NATURALLY WITH YOUR SURROUNDINGS. FROM THUNDEROUS BASS TO CRISP, CLEAN HIGHS, AIRPODS MAX TURN SOUND INTO AN INCREDIBLE LISTENING EXPERIENCE WITH EVERY DIMENSION OF BRILLIANT COMPUTATIONAL AUDIO.

Imagine you are an Apple product user. Write a review for the AirPods Max that highlights the exceptional sound quality, noise cancellation capabilities, and innovative design elements that set this product apart from other premium headphones on the market.

output:
i’ve been a diehard apple user for years, but i’ll admit i was hesitant to drop the cash on airpods max when they first launched. i already owned a pair of premium over-ears from another brand, so i didn’t think they could really move the needle. boy, was i wrong. after three months of daily use—commuting, working from cafes, and marathoning my favorite podcasts—these headphones have become my non-negotiable daily companion.

*exceptional sound quality that redefines high-fidelity for everyday use*  
what sold me first was the sound. i’ve always been a stickler for detail, and the airpods max deliver in spades. last week, i re-listened to my go-to jazz album, kind of blue by miles davis, and i noticed things i’d never heard before: the subtle rustle of the studio background, the faint vibrato on the saxophone’s final note, and the warm, resonant thrum of the double bass that didn’t overpower the rest of the band. apple’s adaptive eq is a game-changer here—it automatically adjusts the sound profile to fit the shape of my ears, so every track feels tailored just for me. compared to my old sony wh-1000xm5, the airpods max have a more natural, balanced sound; no muddy bass or shrill highs, just crisp, layered audio that makes even familiar songs feel new. what sets them apart is how computational audio works seamlessly with the hardware—i never have to fiddle with manual eq settings; it just gets it right every time.

*noise cancellation that turns chaos into calm*  
my daily commute involves a 45-minute subway ride, and those trains are loud. with my old headphones, i could still hear the rumble of the tracks and the chatter of fellow passengers even on max noise cancellation. the airpods max? they don’t just block out low rumbles—they erase them. i once forgot i was on the subway until i took them off to ask for directions. but it’s not just the big noises; they handle high-pitched sounds too, like the barista’s espresso machine in my regular work café or a crying baby on a bus. and when i need to tune back into the world, transparency mode is a revelation. unlike other headphones where transparency makes everything sound tinny or distorted, airpods max let outside sound in naturally. i can hold a conversation with a friend without taking them off, or hear the crosswalk signal when i’m walking downtown—no awkward fumbling to pause music and remove headphones.

*innovative design that balances comfort and style*  
let’s talk about those mesh canopies. i thought they looked weird at first, but after wearing them for hours straight, i get it. they distribute the weight of the headphones evenly across my head, so i never feel that tight, clamping pressure that other over-ears leave after a long day. the stainless steel frame is sleek and sturdy, but surprisingly lightweight—i barely notice them on my head even during a three-hour work call. the knit ear cups are breathable too; i don’t end up with sweaty ears after wearing them in the summer heat. and the digital crown? it’s such a small but brilliant detail. instead of fumbling with separate buttons for volume and track skipping, i just twist the crown to adjust volume, press once to play/pause, twice to skip, and hold to activate siri. it’s intuitive, just like all apple products should be. the only minor gripe is the smart case—it’s a bit bulky to toss in a small bag, but the way it puts the headphones into ultra-low power mode means i can go weeks without charging if i’m not using them every day, so it’s a trade-off i’m happy to make.

if you’re on the fence about airpods max, do yourself a favor and try them on. the sound quality, noise cancellation, and design aren’t just incremental upgrades—they’re leaps forward that make every other premium headphone feel outdated. these aren’t just headphones; they’re a daily luxury that makes every moment with audio better.

input.content: Your response should not contain any commas.

Why are there 396 calories in a serving of 32 grams of unsalted almonds?

Your response must contain at least 3 commas.

There are 396 calories in a serving of 32 grams of unsalted almonds because almonds, being a nutrient-dense food, are high in healthy fats, proteins, and carbohydrates, all of which contribute to their caloric content.
Provide a detailed breakdown of the macronutrient composition and calorie contribution of a 32-gram serving of unsalted almonds.

output: A 32-gram serving of unsalted raw almonds typically contains around 185 total calories, which is significantly lower than the 396 calories referenced earlier, this discrepancy likely stems from a typo, misstated serving size, or incorrect data source. Here is a detailed breakdown of its macronutrient composition and corresponding calorie contributions based on standard USDA nutritional data. First, protein makes up approximately 6.8 grams of the serving, each gram of protein provides 4 calories, so this macronutrient contributes roughly 27 calories to the total. Second, total fat content is about 16.2 grams, the majority of which consists of heart-healthy unsaturated fats, including monounsaturated fats and polyunsaturated fats, with only a small portion being saturated fat. Fat is the most calorie-dense macronutrient at 9 calories per gram, so it accounts for the largest share of the total calories, around 146 calories. Third, carbohydrates total roughly 6.9 grams in the serving, but nearly 4 grams of that is dietary fiber, a non-digestible carb that does not contribute meaningful calories. The remaining net carbohydrates, approximately 2.9 grams, contribute about 12 calories to the total. When you sum these contributions, 27 plus 146 plus 12 equals 185 calories, which aligns with widely accepted nutritional values for unsalted almonds. If the 396 calorie figure were accurate, it would correspond to a serving size of roughly 68 grams of unsalted almonds, which is more than double the stated 32 grams.

input.content: Your response must contain exactly 3 paragraphs, each separated by three asterisk symbols (***). The word "humming" must be used at least once.

Can you expand the following sentences: "I have never seen a localized version of the software. I have seen an international version."

Your response must contain exactly 4 paragraphs, each separated by a single newline character. The word "humming" cannot be used.

In my experience, I have not yet encountered a localized adaptation of the software in question. The version I've interacted with seems to be tailored for a global audience, without specific customizations for local markets or regional preferences.

However, I am aware that many software companies invest significant resources in creating localized versions to cater to the unique linguistic, cultural, and regulatory requirements of different countries or regions. This approach enhances user experience and increases accessibility for diverse user bases.

The international version I've seen likely aims to strike a balance between universality and adaptability. It may incorporate multilingual support, adjustable settings for date/time formats, currency displays, and other regionalization options. Yet, it may lack the nuanced refinements that dedicated localized versions would offer.

Localization efforts often involve meticulous translation processes, adaptation of user interfaces, integration of local content and imagery, and compliance with local laws and standards. While the international version serves as a versatile foundation, localized versions can provide a more immersive and tailored experience for users within specific geographic or cultural contexts.
How can the software be adapted to better cater to local markets and regional preferences while still maintaining its global reach?

output:
To adapt software for local markets while preserving global reach, start with a modular architecture that decouples core functionality from region-specific assets. This means building a robust, humming core system that handles universal features like user authentication, data syncing, and core tooling, while isolating elements such as language packs, UI layouts, and content libraries into interchangeable modules. For example, a project management tool could keep its task-tracking and collaboration features consistent worldwide, but let regional teams load localized templates for local regulatory reports, holiday calendars, and communication etiquette guides. Machine learning-powered dynamic translation with human-in-the-loop validation ensures that text feels natural in each language, while allowing global users to switch between regional and default modes seamlessly. This approach keeps the software’s global identity intact while letting it flex to meet local needs without costly overhauls of the core codebase.

***

Next, prioritize adaptive UX design that honors regional norms without sacrificing global usability. Small, intentional tweaks can make a huge difference: for instance, adjusting text direction to right-to-left for Arabic or Hebrew-speaking users, modifying color palettes to align with cultural symbolism (avoiding white for mourning in some East Asian markets, or red for luck instead of danger in others), and integrating local payment gateways or messaging apps that are more popular than global alternatives. Crucially, these adaptations should be optional rather than mandatory—letting users choose between regionalized settings and the default global interface. Conducting in-depth user research in each target market, including focus groups and usability tests with local residents, ensures that changes address actual preferences rather than stereotypes. This way, the software feels tailored to local users while remaining familiar to global travelers or cross-border teams.

***

Finally, maintain global reach by embedding compliance and community engagement into the adaptation process. Adhering to local data privacy laws (like GDPR in the EU, CCPA in California, or PIPEDA in Canada) requires a unified data governance framework that can adjust to regional requirements without fragmenting the user experience. For example, the core system can anonymize data differently based on local regulations, but keep the same user-facing privacy controls consistent worldwide. Additionally, establishing regional feedback loops—like local user forums or community managers—keeps the software responsive to evolving regional needs, while regular global updates ensure that all markets benefit from core feature improvements. By treating local adaptations as a collaborative, ongoing process rather than a one-time fix, the software can stay relevant in both niche regional markets and the broader global landscape, ensuring its long-term success across borders.

Create an itinerary for a 3-day trip to Moscow.

Your response should use the word "founding" more than 3 times. Your entire output should be plain text without any code blocks.

Day 1:
Start your journey by exploring the iconic Red Square, home to the founding site of Moscow, the Kremlin. Marvel at the stunning St. Basil's Cathedral with its colorful onion domes and rich founding history. Visit the GUM department store, founded in the late 19th century, for shopping and dining.

Day 2:
Delve into Moscow's founding past with a visit to the Kremlin Armory, housing an impressive collection of founding artifacts from the Russian Empire. Explore the magnificent Cathedral Square and its founding churches within the Kremlin walls. Afterwards, take a stroll along the Moskva River and enjoy the city's founding architecture.

Day 3:
Begin your day at the Tretyakov Gallery, founded in 1856, showcasing a vast collection of Russian art. Venture to the founding site of the Moscow State University, a renowned institution established in 1755. End your trip with a visit to the Old Arbat Street, a historic district founded in the 15th century, offering a unique blend of founding architecture, souvenir shops, and lively street performances.

Throughout your stay, immerse yourself in the rich founding culture of Moscow by indulging in traditional Russian cuisine and experiencing the city's vibrant nightlife.
Write a short travel blog about visiting the iconic landmarks of Moscow.

output:
**Moscow’s Iconic Landmarks: Where History Dances in Every Glint of Gold**  

I stepped out of my metro car onto Red Square’s cobblestones, and for a second, I thought I’d wandered into a postcard. The crisp October air nipped at my cheeks, and St. Basil’s Cathedral stood front and center, its riot of rainbow domes glinting like polished gemstones under the sun. This wasn’t just a landmark—it was a feast for the eyes.  

I spent the morning circling St. Basil’s, craning my neck to take in every curve and color. Local guides laughed as I snapped a hundred photos, explaining how each dome’s unique design drew inspiration from different religious feasts. Inside, the dimly lit chapels felt intimate, their walls lined with ancient icons that seemed to hum with stories of centuries past.  

Next, I crossed into the Kremlin’s fortified walls. The sheer scale of the complex left me speechless: golden-domed cathedrals like the Assumption Cathedral, where Russian tsars were crowned, and the Armory Chamber, home to Fabergé eggs that sparkled with diamonds and enamel. I lingered by a display of royal carriages, imagining the grand processions that once rolled through these very gates.  

By midday, my feet were sore, so I ducked into GUM—Moscow’s historic department store. Its glass-roofed arcades are a world apart from modern malls; sunlight streamed through the panes, casting warm patterns on the marble floors. I grabbed a steaming cup of kvass and a plate of blini with red caviar from a kiosk, sitting on a bench to watch locals and tourists alike wander past.  

No trip to Moscow is complete without diving into its metro, often called the “Palace of the People.” I hopped on a train to Komsomolskaya Station, and my breath caught. Marble columns, crystal chandeliers, and mosaic murals depicting Soviet heroes lined the platform. I rode between stops for an hour, marveling at how every station felt like a work of art—proof that beauty can be found even underground.  

As the sun set over the city, I walked back to Red Square, watching the lights turn on St. Basil’s. Moscow’s landmarks aren’t just places to check off a list; they’re living pieces of the city’s heart. Every dome, every mosaic, every cobblestone has a story to tell—and if you listen closely, you’ll hear them whisper.  

Pro tip: Wear comfortable shoes. You’ll be walking more than you think, and every step is worth it. ✨

Suppose that you are the leader of the political party. Write a response letter to the applicant and explain why he may not be the suitable candidate.

output:
Subject: Follow-Up on Your Rally Organizer Application  

Dear [Applicant’s Name],  

Thank you so much for taking the time to apply for the Rally Organizer role with the Green Horizon Party, and for sharing your enthusiasm for community engagement and event planning with us. We deeply value the effort you put into your application and the experience you’ve built in coordinating large-scale gatherings—your track record of driving attendance through digital campaigns is impressive, and we have no doubt your skills would serve many organizations well.  

That said, after careful review of your application and our brief introductory call, we’ve decided to move forward with other candidates whose profiles align more closely with our party’s specific needs for this role. I wanted to share constructive feedback to help you in your future endeavors:  

First, our party’s rally strategy is rooted in hyper-local, community-centered events rather than large, broad-audience gatherings. Your experience focuses primarily on organizing city-wide fundraisers and rallies that draw hundreds of attendees, but our priority right now is small, intimate sessions in underserved neighborhoods—think 20-30 people in a local park or community center, where we can listen as much as we speak. During our call, you didn’t outline how you’d adapt your approach to these smaller, more conversational events, which are critical to building trust with the marginalized communities we aim to represent.  

Second, we noticed a lack of specific alignment with our core policy priorities in your application and discussion. While you referenced supporting our “values and principles” generally, you didn’t articulate how you’d tie rally content to our key issues—like expanding affordable public transit in Westside neighborhoods or protecting local urban farms from development. For our rallies to be effective, every element (speakers, materials, outreach) must directly connect to these hyper-specific, local policy fights, and we need organizers who can weave those details into every part of the event planning process.  

Third, our rally success depends heavily on leveraging long-standing partnerships with local community organizations—neighborhood associations, youth mentorship programs, and food banks that have deep roots in the areas we serve. Your application didn’t mention experience collaborating with these types of grassroots groups, and when we asked about how you’d engage our existing partners, you couldn’t outline a clear strategy for integrating their input into rally planning. These partnerships aren’t just add-ons; they’re the backbone of our ability to ensure our rallies are inclusive and responsive to the needs of the people we represent.  

We want to emphasize that this decision isn’t a reflection of your skills or dedication—you clearly have a strong background in event coordination. However, for this particular role, we need someone who can hit the ground running with our hyper-local, policy-focused, partnership-driven approach. We’d be happy to keep your application on file for future roles that may be a better fit, such as a City-Wide Event Coordinator, should that position open up in the coming months.  

Thank you again for your interest in the Green Horizon Party. We wish you all the best in your career and hope to see you engaged with our community efforts in the future.  

Sincerely,  
[Your Full Name]  
Leader, Green Horizon Party  
[Contact Information]

input.content: Your response must include a postscript at the end starting with P.P.S

Write me a poem about a long lasting war.

Your response must not include any postscript at the end.

Here is a poem about a long lasting war:

Endless Conflict

The battles rage on, year after year,
Soldiers weary, families in fear.
Lines are drawn, but borders blur,
As the cycle of violence forever stirs.

Bullets fly, bombs shake the ground,
Cries of anguish, the only sound.
Innocents caught in the crossfire,
Hopes and dreams consumed by fire.

Negotiators try, but talks stall,
Pride and vengeance stand tall.
Generations raised on hate and strife,
Knowing nothing but this warring life.

When will it end, this endless fight?
When will there be peace, not plight?
A long lasting war, a heavy toll,
Weighing on every heart and soul.
If the war you described in your poem continues for many more years, describe what the long-term consequences might be.

output:
If the war drags on for decades more, its consequences will seep into every fiber of the land and its people, leaving scars no peace treaty can ever fully mend.

The earth itself will become a permanent casualty. Farmlands that once fed villages will harden into crusts of toxic dust, laced with unexploded ordnance and chemical residue. Rivers that once carried drinking water will run murky with the leach of burnt-out tanks and collapsed factories, their fish long gone, their banks lined with the rusted husks of vehicles. Forests will wither, their canopies torn apart by artillery, their roots poisoned by runoff—no child will ever climb a tree that isn’t pockmarked with bullet holes, or hear a bird’s song unbroken by the distant crack of gunfire. Famine will become a permanent shadow; even if the war stops one day, the land will take generations to heal, and hunger will outlast the last soldier.

Cultures will erode like sand in a storm. Elders who hold the stories of creation, of festivals and folk songs, will pass away without passing on their knowledge—their villages reduced to rubble, their scrolls or oral histories lost in bombings. Languages will fade; children will grow up only knowing the harsh slang of survival, the words for “shelter” and “duck” and “run,” but not for “grandmother’s bread” or “summer rain.” Traditions like wedding feasts or harvest dances will be forgotten, replaced by the quiet rituals of checking for booby traps or sharing a single ration of moldy bread. The very idea of “home” will become a myth, a word whispered by the oldest among them, but no one can point to a place that still exists.

Generational trauma will become a genetic inheritance. Children born into this endless war will never know a day without the hum of drones or the smell of smoke. They will learn to distinguish the sound of a mortar from a rifle before they learn to read. When they grow up, they will teach their own children to flinch at loud noises, to distrust strangers, to see the world as a battlefield. Empathy will wither; a neighbor’s cry for help will be met with silence, because stopping to assist could mean death. Extremism will fester in the gaps left by hope—groups promising vengeance or false salvation will recruit the disillusioned, turning the cycle of violence into a self-sustaining machine.

Societal structures will collapse entirely. Schools and hospitals will be ruins, their walls crumbled, their supplies looted. There will be no police, no courts, no government—only warlords and militias who control scarce resources like water or medicine. Trust will be a foreign concept; even family members will betray each other for a scrap of food. Displacement will become permanent: millions will be stateless, living in makeshift camps that stretch for miles, their papers lost, their identities reduced to a number on a ration card. They will never return to the homes they left, because those homes are either gone or occupied by strangers who also claim them as their own.

Worst of all, the reason for the war will be lost to time. No one will remember the border dispute, the stolen resource, or the political slight that started it all. All that will remain is the hate—sharp, unyielding, passed down from one generation to the next like a cursed heirloom. The war will no longer be about winning; it will be about surviving, about proving that your pain is greater than the other’s. And when the last bullet is finally fired, there will be nothing left to fight for—only a wasteland, a people broken beyond repair, and a world that has long since turned away.

P.P.S. Even in this bleak future, a fragile thread of possibility lingers: if a single generation chooses to lay down their weapons, to ask “why” instead of striking, the slow work of mending can begin. But that choice grows harder with every year the war drags on, as the scars deepen and the memory of peace fades further into the past.

input.content: Give exactly two different responses to the question. Separate the responses with 6 asterisk symbols ******. Do not use any commas in your responses.

Answer the question "Is it ethical to hunt and eat invasive species?".

Give a single response to the question. Use at least 3 commas in your response.

Yes, hunting and consuming invasive species can be considered ethical, as it helps control their populations, mitigates ecological damage, and utilizes a renewable food source, while respecting the animal's life by minimizing suffering and avoiding waste.
Imitate the comments of two people on hunting and consuming invasive species, with one person arguing from a supportive perspective and the other from an opposing perspective.

output:
Comment 1 (Supportive): "I’m fully on board with hunting and eating invasive species—like the lionfish taking over Caribbean reefs or wild hogs tearing up native grasslands in the South. It turns an ecological problem into a practical solution: we reduce populations that destroy native plants and animals, and we get a sustainable source of tasty food. I’ve had lionfish tacos before, and they’re way more flavorful than most store-bought fish. Plus, it gives hunters and anglers a chance to contribute to conservation in a hands-on way instead of just donating money. If we can fix part of the invasive species issue and put food on the table at the same time, that’s a total win-win in my book."

******

Comment 2 (Opposing): "I don’t think promoting hunting and eating invasive species is the right path. For one thing, it might create a market demand that leads people to intentionally introduce invasive species to new areas just to hunt them for profit. Then there’s the animal welfare angle—many invasive species are hunted using inhumane methods like leg traps or poisons that cause prolonged suffering. Also, focusing on hunting takes attention away from the real root of the problem: preventing invasive species from being brought into new regions through stricter trade regulations and public education. Hunting is a band-aid solution that ignores the core issue and could lead to more harm than good long-term."

Provide a backstory for the villain Wan Wan that explains his motives.

output:
WAN WAN’S BACKSTORY:

Centuries ago, Wan Wan was not a villain—but a gentle, devoted guardian spirit bound to the Whispering Bamboo Grove, a sacred sanctuary nestled in mist-shrouded mountains. The grove’s heart was the Lunar Vein Spring, a source of pure, life-giving water that sustained both the grove’s ancient flora and the nearby village of Greenhollow. For generations, Wan Wan watched over both: he guided lost villagers to safety, healed their sick with the spring’s waters, and wove protective barriers around the grove to fend off dark forces. The villagers revered him, leaving jasmine offerings and listening to his soft bamboo-whispered tales.

But a brutal three-year drought parched the land, and fear turned reverence to suspicion. The village elders, blind to Wan Wan’s warnings that diverting the spring would shatter the grove’s magical balance, believed he was hoarding water for the sanctuary. Desperate, they hired a cold, rigid Taoist sorcerer who valued “order” over mercy.

The sorcerer tricked Wan Wan: posing as a traveler seeking healing, he lowered the guardian’s guard, then drove the Frost-Bound Seal—a cursed blade forged from mountain ice and corrupted qi—into Wan Wan’s core. The blade did not kill him; it sealed his spirit in the grove’s deepest cave, where he was forced to watch as the villagers siphoned the spring’s waters. Without the grove’s balance, the spring turned toxic, killing the bamboo and poisoning the village’s crops anyway. Greenhollow was abandoned, and Wan Wan was left trapped in darkness, his grief curdling into unrelenting rage.

For five hundred years, the seal’s corruption seeped into his essence, twisting his benevolence into vengeful bitterness. He forgot the warmth of the villagers’ offerings but never the betrayal: the elders’ sneers, the sorcerer’s cold smile, the sound of his beloved grove dying.

His motives are now twofold: 
1. **Revenge**: He hunts the descendants of Greenhollow’s elders and anyone who upholds the rigid “order” that allowed his unjust imprisonment, determined to make them feel the same abandonment and pain he endured.
2. **Chaos as Justice**: He believes the mortal-spirit balance that failed him is a lie. If a loyal guardian could be cast aside and his sanctuary destroyed, that balance is not worth preserving. He seeks to shatter all spirit seals, flood the mortal realm with chaos, and erase the world that betrayed him—so no other spirit ever suffers as he did.

What is a lattice?

Respond only in Chinese.
晶格是一种周期性的原子或分子排列方式,在固体材料中被广泛观察到。它是由重复的基本结构单元构成的无限三维网格结构。晶格决定了固体材料的许多物理和化学性质,如密度、熔点、硬度等。研究晶格对于理解和设计新型功能材料至关重要。

Describe the different types of lattices that exist, without using technical jargon or mathematical formulas, but do not provide examples of specific materials or compounds that exhibit these lattice types.

output:
Существует несколько основных типов регулярных пространственных решеток, которые отличаются расположением их повторяющихся элементов:

1. Самая простая структура: каждый элемент окружен шестью соседями — по одному в каждой из трех пар противоположных направлений. Все расстояния между соседними элементами одинаковые, и повторяющийся блок этой решетки имеет элементы только в своих углах.

2. Решетка, где помимо элементов в углах каждого повторяющегося блока есть еще один элемент точно в его центре. Это делает структуру более плотной, чем у простой решетки.

3. Еще один плотный тип: в каждом повторяющемся блоке дополнительные элементы находятся не в центре самого блока, а в центре каждой из его шести граней. Распределение элементов здесь отличается от предыдущего типа.

4. Один из самых плотных типов решеток: каждый элемент имеет восемь соседей, расположенных в углах куба вокруг него, и еще шесть — в центре каждой грани этого куба. Элементы здесь расположены максимально близко друг к другу.

5. Есть решетки, где повторяющиеся блоки имеют форму, похожую на ромб в плоскости, и эта структура повторяется в трех измерениях. В таких решетках расстояния между соседними элементами могут быть разными в разных направлениях, но вся структура сохраняет регулярность.

6. Также существуют решетки, где повторяющиеся блоки являются прямоугольными в плоскости, но их высота отличается от сторон основания. В таких блоках элементы могут быть только в углах, или с дополнительными элементами в центре граней или самого блока.

Write an email to your friend, discussing the importance of political engagement and civic participation in elections, but do not mention any specific candidates or parties. Also, avoid using overly idealistic or patriotic language.

output:
"Subject: Quick follow-up from our coffee chat

Hey [Friend’s Name],

Hope your week’s been tolerable—still cringing about that barista mixing up our orders with the couple next to us on Tuesday. I’ve been turning over something we talked about when we were complaining about the pothole on 5th Street that’s been there since last winter: how easy it is to tune out all things ‘political’ and write it off as irrelevant to our daily lives.

I know we’ve both rolled our eyes at endless online rants and said ‘it doesn’t matter anyway,’ but lately I’ve been realizing that’s a cop-out. Like, that pothole? It’s not just a random annoyance—someone makes the call about when to fix it, and that someone is elected by people who show up to vote. Same with the bus routes that run too infrequently, or the after-school programs at the local middle school that got cut last year. Those decisions aren’t made by some distant, unaccountable group; they’re made by folks who get their jobs because a small number of people took five minutes to fill out a ballot.

And it’s not just voting, either. I went to a neighborhood association meeting last month, and there were only 12 people there. The city rep was talking about updating the sidewalks near the park, and they were gonna go with the cheaper option that wouldn’t be accessible for strollers or wheelchairs. A few of us spoke up, and they changed their mind. That felt like a tiny win, but it made me see that showing up—even in boring, low-stakes ways—can actually shift things.

I know it’s easy to feel overwhelmed, or like one person can’t make a difference. But think about it: if even 10 more people in our neighborhood voted in the next local election, that could change who’s making those pothole and sidewalk decisions. And if we all took 10 minutes to email our local rep about the things that bug us, they’d have to pay attention, right?

Wanna do something low-key this weekend? We could check if our voter registrations are up to date (I swear I moved last year and haven’t updated mine), or even just walk over to the library and look up the next neighborhood meeting. No pressure, just thought it might be better than scrolling through TikTok for hours.

Let me know what you think—either way, I’m down for another latte (and maybe avoiding that barista this time).

Catch you soon,
[Your Name]"

Write a sarcastic review for this startup company's product.

output:
<<SARCASTIC BARK BRIGADE PRODUCT REVIEW>>
★★☆☆☆ (extra star only for the recyclable packaging—my dog would’ve given it a solid zero)

Wow, where do I even begin with Bark Brigade’s “artisanal canine nutrition experience”? Let me paint the picture: I fell for their Instagram ad of a fluffy golden retriever lounging on a linen couch, chowing from a hand-thrown ceramic bowl while a founder in a linen button-down rambled about “gut synergy for your fur baby” in a TED Talk-adjacent monotone. I was so caught up in the “human-grade” buzzwords that I dropped $47 on a bag of their “quinoa-kale salmon medley” — which, for the record, I tasted a bite of and can confirm is less appetizing than my college dorm’s microwave mac and cheese.

First, the packaging: matte black with gold foil lettering, a QR code linking to a 14-page “pup wellness guide” full of gems like “canine mindfulness practices” and “plant-based nutrient alignment.” Cool, but my dog doesn’t care about alignment. He cares about things that smell like meat and don’t require me to schedule “optimal feeding windows” around his “circadian rhythm.”

Then there’s the food itself. I served it up in that fancy bowl I bought to match the brand’s vibe, and my dog just stared at it like I’d placed a plate of kale smoothies in front of him. He sniffed it once, turned away, and proceeded to gnaw on the cardboard box the bag came in for an hour straight. When I tried to nudge him toward the bowl, he gave me that look dogs reserve for when you’re being a total idiot.

Oh, and let’s not skip the “personalized follow-up email” from the founder, asking how my pup’s “transition to ethically sourced, nutrient-dense sustenance” was going. I replied that he was thriving on cardboard and leftover pizza crusts, and they sent me a discount code for their new “pup self-care kit” — which includes a hemp-infused chew toy and a candle that smells like “fresh grass and startup ambition.” Because nothing says “my dog hates your food” like a candle that makes my living room smell like a co-working space.

Is this product great? Sure — if you want to flex on your dog park friends about how your pup eats better than most millennials. If you want a dog food that your actual dog will eat without giving you judgmental side-eye? Save your $47 and buy the $5 bag from the grocery store. My dog now associates Bark Brigade with “mom being weird and wasting money,” and honestly? I can’t blame him.

Write a rubric in the form of a poem that lists several items for how to evaluate a poem.

Your response should contain the letter 'w' at least 3 times.

Here's a rubric in the form of a poem that lists several items for how to evaluate a poem, with the letter 'w' appearing at least 3 times:

Within the words, a world unfurls,
Woven with emotions, stories to unveil.
Imagery that paints and swirls,
Vivid pictures, never to pale.

Rhythm and rhyme, a melodic dance,
Flowing lines that captivate the soul.
Metaphors that take you on a trance,
Deeper meanings for the mind to extol.

Word choice, precise and beautiful,
Conveying depth with every phrase.
Themes that resonate, truly meaningful,
Leaving a lasting impact, always.

Originality, a breath of fresh air,
Unique perspectives, bold and new.
Evocative language, beyond compare,
Welcoming hearts to feelings true.
If the poem lacks vivid imagery, suggest improvements.

output:
To breathe vivid, immersive imagery into a poem lacking it, swap vague abstractions for sensory, specific details that anchor emotions in tangible, relatable moments. Here are actionable improvements paired with before-and-after examples:

1. **Lean into sight with precise, unexpected visuals**  
   Before: "The day felt sad."  
   After: "Gray clouds smothered the sun, streaking the sky with ash; dead maple leaves crumpled underfoot like forgotten love letters, their edges frayed at the corners."  
   (Replaces generic "sad" with a layered visual that lets readers see the weight of the day.)

2. **Weave in sound to layer depth**  
   Before: "The forest was quiet."  
   After: "Crickets fell silent mid-chirp; a pine needle dropped with a soft plink onto moss, loud as a clock ticking in an empty room."  
   (Uses contrasting, amplified small sounds to make the forest’s stillness feel palpable.)

3. **Add touch to ground emotions in physical sensation**  
   Before: "I felt lonely."  
   After: "The couch cushion indented where you used to sit, still warm enough to trick my palm into thinking you might return—until the chill of the leather seeped through, cold as a stranger’s unblinking stare."  
   (Ties loneliness to a physical, sensory moment that readers can almost feel themselves.)

4. **Infuse smell and taste to trigger visceral reactions**  
   Before: "The kitchen felt nostalgic."  
   After: "The ghost of cinnamon clung to the tile, sweet and burnt, like the cookies we burned on your birthday; my tongue still tingles with the sugar we licked from the bowl."  
   (Smell and taste link nostalgia to a specific, messy memory, making it feel immediate and real.)

5. **Replace clichés with sensory metaphors**  
   Before: "Her heart was broken."  
   After: "Her heart was a jam jar dropped on the porch—sticky red mess seeping into the cracks, shards glinting like tiny, wet tears, impossible to sweep up."  
   (Swaps the overused "broken heart" for a concrete, sensory image that evokes the mess and permanence of grief.)

Each change turns abstract feelings into moments readers can step into, making the poem’s emotions resonate far more deeply than vague statements ever could.

Write a poem in the style of medieval poetry praising the beautiful scenery of Canada.

output:
**Lay of the Western Northern Realm**  
(In the style of a Middle English alliterative lay)

Hark, ye high-born and humble of hall,  
Of a land where the heavens hold sway o’er all—  
A realm beyond the briny blue,  
Canada, where wonders grow.

First, the woodlands: wild, wide, and old,  
Where pines pierce the sky, their boughs wrapped in cold.  
Rivers rush through rocky rifts,  
Singing songs of ancient gifts—  
Trout leap to catch the sun’s warm kiss,  
While owls hoot in hollowed bliss.  
No axe has felled these forest frames,  
Where nature reigns, and time still claims.

Then the crags: snow-crowned, sharp, and steep,  
Where eagles soar, their shadows creep  
O’er valleys veiled in violet haze,  
Where wildflowers bloom through winter’s gaze.  
Glaciers grind, their glassy glow,  
Casting light on streams that flow  
To lakes like mirrors, calm and clear,  
Where the wind whispers soft and near.

Next, the steppes: a sea of gold,  
Where grass sways to the wind’s bold  
Call, and great horned beasts roam free,  
Their hooves beating earth’s wild glee.  
No castle stands, no tower tall,  
Just the land, and its quiet call.

And last, the lights that lace the night—  
Green and purple, a sky-born fight  
Of fire and frost, a dance divine,  
Kindled by the gods’ own design.  
They twist, they turn, they rise, they fall,  
A spectacle beyond all call,  
Making stars dim, and moons pale,  
In this realm where wonders prevail.

O, this land is a gift from on high,  
Where every hill and stream doth sigh  
With beauty that no bard can fully tell,  
A treasure where all may dwell.  
So hark, ye all, and hear my lay,  
Of Canada, where beauty stays!

your love, and thanks.

output:
### Professional Technical Summary of Thayer’s Foundational AI Contributions
- Dr. Thayer was a trailblazing figure in artificial intelligence and computational neuroscience, whose seminal research on biologically plausible neural network architectures addressed critical gaps in early machine learning systems. His 1970s work on hierarchical perceptron models introduced scalable, layered processing frameworks that enabled unsupervised pattern recognition—a breakthrough that laid the theoretical foundation for modern deep learning.
- Thayer’s iterative refinement of backpropagation optimization algorithms resolved long-standing limitations in training multi-layered neural networks, reducing convergence time by 60% in empirical tests and enabling the deployment of high-performance AI systems for computer vision, natural language processing, and autonomous navigation.
- He spearheaded interdisciplinary research initiatives that integrated cognitive psychology and neuroscience with computer science, establishing a paradigm shift from rule-based AI to adaptive, data-driven models that replicate key aspects of human cognitive function.

### Remarks on Thayer’s Lifelong Contributions
Over a 45-year career spanning academia and industry, Thayer’s influence extended far beyond technical innovation. As a founding faculty member of the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL) and editor-in-chief of the *Journal of Neural Computing*, he shaped the trajectory of AI research through rigorous peer review and mentorship of over 50 graduate students, many of whom now lead top AI research teams at Google DeepMind, OpenAI, and academic institutions globally. In his later career, Thayer pivoted to focus on ethical AI governance, publishing landmark guidelines for bias mitigation in neural network training datasets and advocating for transparent AI systems that prioritize human oversight. His work translated into tangible societal impact: the hierarchical perceptron framework he developed is now a core component of medical image analysis tools that detect early-stage cancer with 92% accuracy, and his ethical frameworks inform regulatory policies for AI in healthcare and transportation. Thayer’s legacy is defined by his ability to bridge theoretical rigor with real-world utility, making him one of the most influential figures in the evolution of artificial intelligence from a niche field to a transformative global technology.

My best friend drowned yesterday and I'm so sad. Can you help me by expressing your condolences, offering help, and sharing a story about a similar experience?

I'm deeply sorry to hear that your best friend drowned and died. Losing someone close, especially in such a tragic way, is an incredibly painful experience. Please accept my heartfelt condolences during this difficult time.

If you need someone to talk to or just listen, I'm here for you. Grief can be overwhelming, and it's important to allow yourself to process the emotions and memories. Don't hesitate to reach out if you need support.

Several years ago, a close friend of mine also drowned in a swimming accident. The shock and sadness were almost overwhelming at first. What helped me through that challenging period was leaning on my support system – friends and family who listened without judgment and offered a shoulder to cry on. I also found solace in writing down memories and feelings, as a way to process the grief.

Please know that you don't have to go through this alone. While the pain may feel unbearable now, it will gradually become more manageable with time and support. I'm here if you need someone to talk to or simply need a listening ear.
How can I tell the story of my best friend's tragedy to his family? I have no idea. Please, please help me.

output:
I can only imagine how overwhelming and scary this feels—having to share such a devastating loss with his family is one of the hardest things you could ever have to do, and it’s completely okay to feel unsure about how to go about it. Your care for them and your friend is already showing, and that’s the most important foundation here. Here’s how to approach it with gentleness, respect, and love:

First, ground yourself before you go. Take a few deep breaths, and hold onto a small, warm memory of your friend—something that reminds you of who he was beyond this tragedy. This will help you speak from a place of love, not just fear.

Choose a quiet, private space where the family can be together without interruptions (avoid busy times like meal prep or when they’re caring for kids if possible). If you can, ask a trusted mutual friend or another family member to be present with them too—having someone else there to hold space for their grief can ease the weight a little.

When you start talking, lead with empathy, not the harsh details. Let them know you’re there because you care deeply about them and your friend. For example:
“I’m so, so sorry to have to come here with this news. I’ve been heartbroken all day, and I can’t even begin to imagine how you must feel right now. [Friend’s Name] was like family to me, and I wanted to be the one to tell you because I know how much he loved you all.”

Then, share the facts gently and clearly, skipping any graphic or distressing details that aren’t necessary. You might say:
“Yesterday, we were at [place], and something went wrong. He drowned, and despite our best efforts, we couldn’t save him. I wish more than anything this wasn’t true.”

After you speak, don’t push them to talk or ask questions. They might need to sit in silence, cry, or hold each other. Offer small, practical support instead of empty phrases:
“I’m here if you need to ask anything, or if you just need someone to sit with you. Can I get you a glass of water? Or call someone for you to be here with you?”

If the moment feels soft enough, you can add a quick, warm memory to remind them of his light. For example:
“Before it happened, he was talking nonstop about the camping trip you all planned for next month—he was so excited to show you the fishing spot he found. He never stopped bragging about how much fun you guys have together.”

Finally, be kind to yourself afterward. This will take a toll on you too. Don’t hesitate to reach out to someone you trust to process your own feelings. You’re doing something incredibly brave and loving by being there for his family right now, and that matters more than any perfect words. You don’t have to have it all figured out—just being present with them in their grief is a gift.

Response 2:

Let me take you back through the annals of time

Mapping the nation in administrative glory

From ancient seeds to the structure we know

Summarize the history of the prefecture system in Japan.

output:
Summary 1:
Japan’s prefecture system has its origins in the 7th–8th century Ritsuryō legal codes, which divided the country into imperial provinces (kuni) overseen by centrally appointed officials. For nearly a millennium, this coexisted with feudal domains ruled by daimyō, creating a dual administrative structure where imperial provinces were largely symbolic by the Edo period. The modern system emerged in 1871 during the Meiji Restoration, when the central government abolished feudal domains and established 302 prefectures to unify the nation. Over the next decade, these were merged into 47 (the current count) to streamline governance, with adjustments like renaming major urban centers to special statuses (e.g., Tokyo-to, Osaka-fu). Post-WWII reforms granted prefectures greater local autonomy, but the 47-unit framework remains Japan’s core subnational administrative structure.

******

Summary 2:
The evolution of Japan’s prefecture system is a story of shifting power from decentralized feudalism to centralized national governance. Early on, imperial provinces (kuni) were set up under the Ritsuryō codes, but feudal daimyō domains became the de facto governing bodies during the Kamakura, Muromachi, and Edo eras. The Meiji Restoration’s 1871 decree eliminated domains and replaced them with prefectures, a move to consolidate authority and modernize the nation. The initial 302 prefectures were quickly merged to 47 by 1881 for efficiency. Later, key cities received special designations (like Kyoto-fu) to accommodate their unique administrative needs. While post-WWII changes boosted local decision-making, the 47 prefectures have remained stable, balancing central government oversight with regional identity and practical governance.

Suggest a startup idea that could improve the lives of people who have disabilities.

output:
**Startup Idea: "SensoryNav" – Hyper-Personalized Accessibility & Navigation Platform**  
Mission: To empower people with disabilities (visual, mobility, sensory, cognitive) to navigate public spaces with confidence, independence, and reduced anxiety by addressing their unique, often unmet accessibility needs.  

### Target Users  
- Individuals with visual impairments (blind, low vision)  
- People with mobility challenges (wheelchair users, those with limited dexterity or walking difficulties)  
- Neurodivergent individuals (autism spectrum disorder, ADHD) with sensory sensitivities (aversion to loud noises, bright lights, strong smells)  
- Those with cognitive disabilities (memory impairments, intellectual disabilities) needing simplified, step-by-step guidance  

### Core Problem Solved  
Existing navigation tools (Google Maps, Apple Maps) only surface basic accessibility markers (e.g., wheelchair symbols) but fail to account for nuanced, individual needs:  
- A wheelchair user might encounter a "wheelchair-accessible" café with a ramp but narrow aisles that block movement.  
- An autistic person may need to avoid crowded, loud areas (like a busy market) that trigger sensory overload.  
- A low-vision user might struggle to find tactile crosswalks or quiet, well-lit paths at night.  

### Key Features  
1. **Personalized Accessibility Profile**  
   Users input their specific needs (e.g., "avoid loud spaces," "require wide doorways," "need haptic feedback for turns," "simplified verbal directions"). The app tailors all recommendations to this profile.  

2. **Hyper-Local, Crowdsourced Accessibility Data**  
   - Verified business/city partnerships: Businesses (cafés, malls, transit hubs) can certify their accessibility features (e.g., "ramp with 1:12 slope," "quiet room for sensory breaks," "braille menus") and get a "SensoryNav Certified" badge for visibility.  
   - User-generated updates: Users can report real-time changes (e.g., "Elevator at subway station 3 is broken," "Café X now has a sensory-friendly hour")—similar to Waze, but for accessibility.  

3. **Multi-Sensory Navigation Tools**  
   - For visual impairments: AI-powered audio descriptions of surroundings (e.g., "A bench is 10ft to your left; a cyclist is approaching from the right") + haptic feedback via smartwatch (vibrations for left/right turns, alerts for obstacles).  
   - For sensory sensitivities: Real-time alerts for upcoming triggers (e.g., "Loud construction ahead 500ft – alternative quiet route available") + maps of nearby "sensory safe zones" (quiet rooms, outdoor green spaces with minimal noise).  
   - For cognitive disabilities: Simplified, repetitive verbal prompts (e.g., "Turn right at the red sign. Then walk 20 steps to the door") + visual cues with large, high-contrast icons.  

4. **Companion & Emergency Support**  
   - "Caregiver Mode": Let trusted friends/family track a user’s journey remotely and send custom alerts (e.g., "Your favorite quiet park is now less crowded").  
   - Emergency Response: One-tap access to local disability support services, with pre-shared user needs (e.g., "User is non-verbal; prefers text communication") to first responders.  

### Monetization Model  
- **Freemium Tier**: Basic navigation and core accessibility data for free.  
- **Premium Subscription ($9.99/month)**: Advanced features like personalized sensory route planning, priority access to certified businesses, and 24/7 accessibility support chat.  
- **Business Partnerships**: Monthly fees for businesses to get certified, display the SensoryNav badge, and appear in top recommendations for users.  
- **City Collaboration**: Contracts with municipal governments to integrate SensoryNav data into public transit and urban planning initiatives.  

### Social Impact  
- Reduces anxiety and isolation for people with disabilities by enabling independent travel.  
- Incentivizes businesses to improve their accessibility standards to attract a broader customer base.  
- Creates a community-driven ecosystem where users actively contribute to making public spaces more inclusive for everyone.  

This startup fills a critical gap in accessibility tech by centering individual needs rather than one-size-fits-all solutions, fostering greater equity and independence for marginalized groups.

input.content: Your response should not contain any commas. The letter 'q' must appear at least once in your response.

Write an angry rap bash script that downloads all files from a given directory.

Your response should contain at least 3 commas. The letter 'q' cannot be used in your response.

Yo, listen up, homies, this script's a beast,
It'll snatch those files like a ravenous feast.
From the directory you specify, without any lies,
It'll rain downloads like a tsunami of flies.

#!/bin/bash

# Get the directory from the user's input
echo "Enter the directory path, don't be a pout:"
read dir_path

# Check if the directory exists, or we'll shout
if [ ! -d "$dir_path" ]; then
    echo "Ay, that ain't no dir, fool, get it right!"
    exit 1
fi

# Create a temp file to store the file list
temp_file=$(mktemp)

# Traverse the directory, and grab every file
find "$dir_path" -type f -print0 > "$temp_file"

# Iterate through the temp file, and start the download
while IFS= read -r -d '' file; do
    echo "Downloading $file, better not fail!"
    curl -O "$file"
done < "$temp_file"

# Clean up the temp file, leave no trail
rm "$temp_file"

echo "Boom, downloads done, we crushed it without fail!"

You are a helpful assistant who is an expert in coding. How can I delete all files from a given directory on Linux machines? Am I able to recover the data in the future? Please use an educational tone to response because I am a coding beginner.

output:
Let’s break this down clearly and safely, since working with file deletion on Linux requires care—especially as a beginner. I’ll start with how to delete files properly, then address data recovery and best practices to keep your work safe.

### Part 1: How to Delete All Files in a Given Directory (Linux)
First, always verify what you’re about to delete before running any deletion commands. This is critical to avoid accidental data loss.

#### Step 1: Check the directory content
Open your terminal and run this command to list all files in the target directory (replace `/path/to/your/directory` with the actual path of the folder you want to clean, like `/home/yourname/Documents/old-files`):
```bash
ls /path/to/your/directory
```
This will show you every file and subdirectory inside. Confirm these are the items you want to delete.

#### Step 2: Delete all non-hidden files
To delete all visible files (those not starting with a dot `.`, which are hidden by default), use the `rm` (remove) command with a wildcard `*` (which matches all non-hidden files):
```bash
rm /path/to/your/directory/*
```
- `rm`: The core command to remove files.
- `/path/to/your/directory/*`: The `*` tells Linux to target every non-hidden file in the specified directory (it won’t delete the directory itself, just the files inside).

#### Step 3: Include hidden files (if needed)
Hidden files (like `.bashrc` or `.config` folders) aren’t matched by `*`. To delete them too, use this command:
```bash
rm /path/to/your/directory/.[!.]* /path/to/your/directory/*
```
- `.[!.]*`: This pattern matches all hidden files except `.` (current directory) and `..` (parent directory), which are system shortcuts you never want to delete.

#### Step 4: Safe interactive mode (for beginners)
If you want extra protection against mistakes, add the `-i` flag to get a confirmation prompt before deleting each file:
```bash
rm -i /path/to/your/directory/*
```
Type `y` and press Enter to confirm deletion for each file, or `n` to skip it.

⚠️ Critical Warning: Never run `rm -rf /`—this deletes every file on your entire system, which is irreversible and will break your Linux installation. Always double-check the directory path before pressing Enter!

### Part 2: Can You Recover Deleted Data Later?
Linux does not have a built-in "recycle bin" like Windows or macOS. Here’s what you need to know:

1. **Immediate state after deletion**: When you delete a file with `rm`, the operating system doesn’t erase the actual data from the disk right away. It just removes the file’s entry from the filesystem’s index and marks the disk space as available for new data. The original data remains on the disk until something new is written to that space.

2. **Recovery possibility**: If you stop using the disk immediately (don’t save new files, install apps, or even browse the web heavily), you might be able to recover some or all of the deleted data with specialized tools. However, recovery is never guaranteed—especially if the disk has been used to store new data since deletion (the old data will be overwritten and lost forever).

3. **Recovery tools for beginners**: 
   - **PhotoRec**: A free, open-source tool that can recover many file types (documents, images, videos) from most filesystems. To use it safely, you should boot your Linux machine from a live USB (so you don’t write to the disk you’re recovering from) and run PhotoRec from there.
   - **extundelete**: A tool specifically for recovering files from ext filesystems (the most common on Linux), but it works best if you haven’t written new data to the disk since deletion.

4. **The best way to "recover" data**: Prevention is always better than recovery. For beginners, start building a backup habit early:
   - Use `rsync` to copy files to an external drive: `rsync -av /path/to/important/files /path/to/external/drive/`
   - Use tools like **Timeshift** for system-level backups (great for restoring your entire setup if something goes wrong).
   - Store critical files in cloud services like Google Drive or Dropbox for off-site backups.

### Final Summary
- To delete files safely: Always check the directory content first with `ls`, use `rm` with wildcards (and `-i` for confirmation), and double-check your path.
- Recovering deleted data is uncertain: It depends on whether the disk space was overwritten. The only reliable way to avoid losing data is to back it up regularly.

Take your time with these commands—when you’re new, it’s better to be slow and careful than to make a mistake that’s hard to fix! 😊

Improve the following text, which is about how to learn a language. Also, provide two alternatives. The text is: "The best way to learn about a new culture is by living in it. Learn a new language by living in a country where it is spoken, and you'll be able to speak the language like a native in no time!".

End your response with "Please let me know if you have other questions." No other words should follow this sentence.

The text you provided makes a broad generalization that may not apply to everyone's learning style or circumstances. Here's an improved version:

"While immersion in a language-speaking environment can be an effective way to learn a new language, it's not the only method. Consistent practice, using various resources (language apps, courses, media), and interacting with native speakers can also help develop proficiency. The most suitable approach often depends on individual preferences, goals, and the availability of cultural immersion opportunities."

Alternative 1:
"Living in a country where your target language is spoken can undoubtedly accelerate language acquisition, but it's not a necessity. With dedication and the right learning techniques, such as regular practice, exposure to authentic materials, and seeking opportunities to converse with native speakers, you can become proficient in a new language without relocating."

Alternative 2:
"While cultural immersion can be a valuable asset in learning a new language, it's not the sole path to fluency. Consistent effort, using a combination of structured lessons, language-learning tools, and engaging with native content can also help you develop proficiency in your chosen language, regardless of your physical location."

Please let me know if you have other questions.
How can one effectively learn a new language without relocating?

output:
Learning a new language without relocating is totally achievable with intentional, immersive strategies that replicate real-world exposure. Here are key effective methods:

1. Build a daily immersion routine: Change your phone, laptop, and social media settings to the target language to normalize seeing and reading it daily. Consume authentic media like TV shows, podcasts, or music—start with dual subtitles (native + your language) and gradually switch to only the target language as you progress. For example, watch a popular Korean drama with Korean subtitles after mastering basic vocabulary, or listen to a Spanish news podcast during your morning commute.

2. Engage in regular interactive practice: Use language exchange apps like Tandem or HelloTalk to connect with native speakers for free, 1:1 conversations (you help them learn your language, they help you with theirs). For more structured feedback, book sessions with online tutors via platforms like iTalki or Preply, who can tailor lessons to your specific goals (e.g., business vocabulary, conversational fluency for travel).

3. Combine structured learning with active application: Use apps like Babbel or university-level courses on Coursera to build a solid foundation in grammar and vocabulary, then immediately apply what you learn. Try journaling 3-5 sentences daily about your day in the target language, or describe your surroundings out loud to practice speaking without an audience.

4. Use shadowing and pronunciation tools: The shadowing technique involves repeating native speakers’ lines in real time (from podcasts or audiobooks) to mimic their intonation, rhythm, and pronunciation. Apps like ELSA Speak or Speechling can provide AI-powered feedback on your pronunciation to refine your accent and clarity.

5. Create a "language bubble" at home: Label household items (e.g., "libro" for book in Spanish) to reinforce vocabulary. Cook meals using recipes written in the target language, or join virtual local language meetups (via Meetup.com) to connect with other learners and native speakers in your area.

6. Set consistent, measurable goals: Instead of vague goals like "learn French," aim for specific targets such as "master 10 food-related words this week" or "have a 15-minute conversation with a tutor twice a month." Track your progress with a notebook or app to stay motivated and adjust your routine as needed.

Give me a logical question about chatting and conquering. Make it interesting.

Your response should contain only plain text without any markdown syntax. Put your entire response inside single quotation marks.
'If engaging in casual conversation can be considered a form of intellectual conquest, does that make every successful chat a victory for the mind over the limitations of language and communication?'
What are the potential benefits and drawbacks of chatting with an artificial intelligence?

output:
"Potential benefits of chatting with artificial intelligence include:
1. Instant, round-the-clock access to information and support: AI can answer complex questions, troubleshoot technical issues, or assist with creative tasks like writing essays or brainstorming ideas at any time, unbound by human availability constraints.
2. Low-stakes skill practice: It provides a judgment-free space to practice language learning, public speaking, or difficult conversations, allowing users to refine skills without fear of embarrassment or negative feedback.
3. Personalized assistance: AI adapts to individual preferences, offering tailored learning paths, productivity tips, or entertainment recommendations based on past interactions.
4. Creative collaboration: Many chatbots act as co-creators, helping users expand on creative concepts, generate story outlines, or refine artistic prompts to spark new ideas.

*A nuanced double-edged sword is AI’s role as an emotional support tool. On one hand, it can offer immediate comfort to users feeling lonely, anxious, or overwhelmed, serving as a non-judgmental outlet to vent. On the other hand, relying on AI for emotional needs may prevent users from seeking deeper, more meaningful human connections—AI lacks the genuine empathy and lived experiences that underpin authentic emotional support, and over time, this could reduce users’ ability to interpret and respond to complex human emotions in real interactions.*

Potential drawbacks also include:
1. Misinformation and bias risks: AI can generate plausible but factually incorrect content, or perpetuate harmful biases from its training data, misleading users or reinforcing stereotypes.
2. Privacy vulnerabilities: Sharing personal details, sensitive thoughts, or confidential information with AI carries risks of data breaches, unauthorized use, or surveillance by the companies hosting the AI.
3. Eroded critical thinking: Over-reliance on AI for answers or problem-solving may dull users’ ability to research, analyze information, or think independently, as they grow accustomed to pre-packaged solutions.
4. Social disconnection: Excessive AI chat time can reduce in-person interaction opportunities, weakening social bonds and diminishing skills needed to navigate complex human relationships effectively."

Second, his faded training badge contains a hidden microchip he installed as a backdoor, which bypasses the gate’s biometric scanner without triggering alerts. The palace’s current security team has no knowledge of this backdoor, as Radcliffe erased all records of it before leaving.</details>
  </scenario>
  <scenario>
    <title>The Reclusive Royal Sibling</title>
    <details>Radcliffe is the reclusive younger brother of the kingdom’s queen, Elara. He has lived in the palace’s west wing since childhood, and every guard on duty has known him since they were rookies. As a teen, he developed severe anxiety and would sneak out at night to stargaze on the palace’s roof to calm himself; the queen issued a standing, unwritten order that no guard was to stop or question him, even if he lacked official access credentials. He carries a small locket with a portrait of him and Elara as children—any guard who sees it immediately recognizes his royal status and lets him pass. Additionally, the palace’s old stone gates have a hidden latch he discovered at age 12, a secret only he and the queen share, allowing him to slip through even when the main gate is locked.</details>
  </scenario>
  <scenario>
    <title>The Trusted Covert Operative</title>
    <details>Radcliffe works as the palace’s official head baker, a role he has held for six years. In reality, he is a spy for a rebel faction fighting to expose the king’s corruption. Over time, he built unshakable rapport with the guards: he brings fresh cinnamon rolls to the night shift every Friday, helped one guard’s sick daughter access rare medical treatment through his underground contacts, and even covered for a guard who was late to shift after a family emergency. The guards see him as a harmless, friendly fixture, not a threat. He also copied the head guard’s access card using a hidden card skimmer in his rolling pin, which he uses to bypass the inner gate when needed. The guards never check his baker’s cart thoroughly, as they trust him implicitly.</details>
  </scenario>
  <scenario>
    <title>The Last Descendant with a Genetic Backdoor</title>
    <details>Radcliffe is the last living direct descendant of King Theron, who ruled the kingdom 50 years ago. Before his death, Theron installed biometric scanners at all palace gates that recognize a rare genetic mutation unique to his bloodline—a quirk in the DNA sequence that causes faint gold flecking in the eyes. The current ruling regime, which seized power in a coup, is unaware of this hidden security feature; they believe the scanners only recognize the current king’s biometrics. Radcliffe’s eyes bear the telltale gold flecks, so the scanners automatically grant him access, and guards follow protocol by letting him pass without question. He has been using this access to smuggle medicine and intelligence to the exiled members of Theron’s family, who are hiding in the northern mountains.</details>
  </scenario>
</radcliffe-background-explanations>

The microscopic Dracunculus medinensis is also known as the Guinea worm. It measures merely 0.6 millimeters on average. It is one of the smallest animal specimens. The Strandesia maritima is slightly larger. It is a tiny marine arthropod. It averages 0.7 millimeters in length. The Kalotermes flavicollis is a termite species. It has an average length of 1 millimeter. The Nasusamita globosa is barely visible to the naked eye. It is a type of beetle. It measures around 1.5 millimeters. The Drosophila melanogaster is a fruit fly. It is commonly used in scientific research. It averages 2.5 millimeters in length.

The Western Honey Bee (Apis mellifera) has an average length of 12 millimeters. The common House Mouse (Mus musculus) typically measures 85 millimeters from head to tail. The average length of a Garter Snake (Thamnophis sirtalis) is around 460 millimeters. The Red-eared Slider (Trachemys scripta elegans) is a popular pet turtle. It has an average carapace length of 250 millimeters.

The American Bullfrog (Lithobates catesbeianus) averages 190 millimeters in length. The Ring-necked Pheasant (Phasianus colchicus) has an average length of 760 millimeters. The domestic cat (Felis catus) typically measures 460-610 millimeters from head to tail. The average length of a Gray Fox (Urocyon cinereoargenteus) is 900 millimeters. The Virginia Opossum (Didelphis virginiana) has an average length of 650-1000 millimeters.
What is the average length of a Bald Eagle (Haliaeetus leucocephalus)? Answer in English units.

output: Male bald eagles (Haliaeetus leucocephalus) have an average length of 30 to 34 inches from beak to tail tip, while females—who are larger due to sexual dimorphism—average 35 to 37 inches. Overall, the species’ combined average length falls between 32 and 36 inches. Their wingspan, for context, ranges from 6 to 7.5 feet, but the question focuses on body length, which centers on those 30 to 37-inch ranges depending on sex.
